modules.name: Quality Check
modules.description: Run comprehensive quality checks (lint, types, tests, coverage)
modules.longDescription: Runs a comprehensive quality check pipeline including linting, type checking, tests, and coverage verification. Essential command before commits and PRs.
modules.whenToUse: Before every commit and PR. Essential for maintaining code quality.

modules.name: Code Check
modules.description: Run code analysis, linting, and formatting checks
modules.longDescription: Focused code analysis command that runs linting, formatting checks, and static analysis. Faster than full quality check for quick validation.
modules.whenToUse: During development for quick code quality feedback. Faster than full quality-check.

modules.name: Run Tests
modules.description: Execute test suites with various options
modules.longDescription: Flexible test runner command supporting unit tests, integration tests, watch mode, coverage, and filtering. Works with Vitest and Jest.
modules.whenToUse: During TDD workflow, before commits, or when validating changes.

modules.name: Security Audit
modules.longDescription: Deep security review covering OWASP Top 10, dependency vulnerabilities, authentication, authorization, and data handling.
modules.whenToUse: Before production deployment or during security reviews.

modules.name: Performance Audit
modules.longDescription: Performance audit covering Core Web Vitals, bundle analysis, database queries, and rendering performance.
modules.whenToUse: Before major launches or when investigating performance issues.

modules.name: Accessibility Audit
modules.longDescription: Accessibility audit following WCAG 2.1 Level AA guidelines. Covers keyboard navigation, screen readers, and color contrast.
modules.whenToUse: Before releases and after UI changes.

modules.name: Start Feature Plan
modules.longDescription: Initiates the Level 3 feature planning workflow for complex, multi-day features. Creates planning session, coordinates agents, and produces PDR, tech analysis, and task breakdown.
modules.whenToUse: When starting complex features that need planning, architecture review, and task breakdown.

modules.name: Start Refactor Plan
modules.longDescription: Initiates a planning session for refactoring work. Analyzes current state, identifies improvement areas, and creates safe refactoring plan with tests.
modules.whenToUse: When planning significant refactoring that affects multiple files or modules.

modules.name: Sync Planning
modules.description: Synchronize planning documents to issue tracker
modules.longDescription: Synchronizes planning documents (PDR, tech analysis, TODOs) to issue trackers like GitHub Issues or Linear. Creates linked issues from task breakdown.
modules.whenToUse: After planning approval to create trackable issues from the task breakdown.

modules.name: Sync Planning to GitHub
modules.longDescription: Syncs planning documents specifically to GitHub Issues. Creates issues with proper labels, milestones, and project board integration.
modules.whenToUse: When using GitHub Issues for task tracking.

modules.name: Sync TODOs to GitHub
modules.description: Sync TODO comments to GitHub Issues
modules.longDescription: Scans codebase for TODO comments and creates/updates GitHub Issues. Tracks technical debt and pending work items.
modules.whenToUse: To track and manage TODO comments in the codebase.

modules.name: Check Completed Tasks
modules.longDescription: Automatically detects completed tasks by analyzing code changes and test results. Updates task status in tracking systems.
modules.whenToUse: Periodically to keep task tracking in sync with actual progress.

modules.name: Planning Cleanup
modules.description: Clean up planning artifacts after completion
modules.longDescription: Cleans up planning artifacts after a feature is complete. Archives planning docs, closes issues, and updates project state.
modules.whenToUse: After a feature is fully deployed and verified.

modules.name: Cleanup Issues
modules.description: Clean up stale and outdated issues
modules.longDescription: Identifies and cleans up stale issues. Closes abandoned issues, labels inactive ones, and generates cleanup reports.
modules.whenToUse: Periodically for issue hygiene and project maintenance.

modules.name: Add New Entity
modules.description: Generate full CRUD entity (model, service, API, tests)
modules.longDescription: Scaffolds a complete entity with database model, service layer, API endpoints, and tests. Follows project conventions and architecture patterns.
modules.whenToUse: When adding new data entities that need full CRUD operations.

modules.name: Update Docs
modules.longDescription: Analyzes code changes and updates relevant documentation including README, API docs, architecture diagrams, and changelog.
modules.whenToUse: After implementing features or making changes that affect documentation.

modules.name: Five Why Analysis
modules.description: Root cause analysis using Five Why method
modules.longDescription: Systematic root cause analysis using the Five Why methodology. Helps identify underlying causes of bugs, issues, or failures.
modules.whenToUse: When debugging complex issues or after incidents to prevent recurrence.

modules.name: Commit
modules.description: Create atomic git commits with conventional messages
modules.longDescription: Creates atomic git commits following conventional commit format. Ensures only task-related files are included and generates proper commit messages.
modules.whenToUse: When committing changes. Ensures atomic commits and proper message format.

modules.name: Format Markdown
modules.longDescription: Formats markdown files following consistent style guidelines. Checks for formatting issues, broken links, and style violations.
modules.whenToUse: Before committing documentation changes or when cleaning up markdown files.

modules.name: Create Agent
modules.longDescription: Creates a new specialized agent with proper structure, configuration, and documentation. Follows the standard agent template.
modules.whenToUse: When adding new capabilities that require a specialized agent.

modules.name: Create Command
modules.longDescription: Creates a new command with proper structure, configuration, and documentation. Follows the standard command template.
modules.whenToUse: When adding new workflow automation commands.

modules.name: Create Skill
modules.longDescription: Creates a new skill with proper structure, configuration, and documentation. Follows the standard skill template.
modules.whenToUse: When adding new reusable knowledge or patterns.

modules.name: Help
modules.description: Show available commands, agents, and documentation
modules.longDescription: Displays help information about available commands, agents, skills, and documentation. Provides quick reference for the AI assistant system.
modules.whenToUse: When unsure what commands are available or how to use the system.
